intro: Erysimum canescens var. subintegerrimum, commonly known as the woolly wallflower, is a perennial herb native to the Mediterranean region. It features hairy, grayish-green foliage that helps it retain moisture in arid environments. The plant produces clusters of bright yellow flowers with four petals, typical of the Brassicaceae family. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and coastal landscapes. Its compact growth habit and ornamental value make it a favored plant among gardeners seeking drought-tolerant species.
